column5: Here is another great day on Simcoe....much better weather than last Tuesday...fish was tough bite but with a bit of work we still got easy limit for all three of us plus bunch more released and lost.  The crown of the day was my son's very first white fish he pulled all the way up from bottom to surface and Chuck just put it in the net nicely...but Jordan did all the reeling and pulling....though he sure got his work cut for him...didn't give up and managed to complete the job with flying colors ha ha ha....it did help that he just woke up after 3 hours sleep on the boat right before that[]  Few of my favorite shots of the day:           Cheers, Ice Fisherman
He'll remember that fish, and this day, for the rest of his life.
I like Picture #2! That's an awsome action shot!  It looks like he's hooked an anchor!  I'd love to see my son on something like that.  Looks like it was a fun day.
Wow, looks like an absolutely perfect day on the water. Good stuff bud!
Awesome pictures!  I was out there today and got a few, lots of bugs too.
Jordan's growing like a weed Emil ! Great stuff... but too boat crowded fishing grounds for me! Chuck.. your barber called! lol
I should have stayed on the phone another two minutes; I would have heard it unfold!!! Great pictures Emil and congrats to Jordan!
That's a great day out on Simcoe, congrats! Love the shots of the kid
At great day to have the kids out. WTG Jordon!
Awesome report ! way to go, great lookin whities.
